comments:
I got a:

failed due to an internal error (took 15:02.488)

message for a Team/Update from a CVS repository.

I am not sure if this problem is due to the fact that the update was long 
running (15 minutes) or because the update contains entrire directory trees 
that were move around in the repository.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 271 Sep 06, 2002 15:33:25.29
!MESSAGE File not found: C:\Documents and Settings\ggregory.PC1073\My 
Documents\eclipse\workspaces\ThirdParty\MicrosoftSecurityClasses\5.00.2922.0
\CVS\Entries.

Now that I look at the state of my PC I have lot the VPN connection to the 
network that hold our CVS repository, so it is possible that the VPN connection 
dropped in the middle of the Team/Update operation but I have no away to prove 
or disprove this. Therefore, if the error mentioned here /could/ be caused by a 
drop connection, this report should probably be placed under the heading of 
trying to give the user a better erroro message. 

Could the error stacks be caused by a dropped connection?

When you say "move around in the repository", do you mean moved using a client 
(delete and add) or moved on the server? Also, was the folder in question 
("C:\Documents and Settings\ggregory.PC1073\My 
Documents\eclipse\workspaces\ThirdParty\MicrosoftSecurityClasses\5.00.2922.0
") one of the deleted folders?

It looks like the Entries file got deleted at just the wrong time. Here's the 
code snipet:

if (! file.exists()) return null; // file exists
   try {
      BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(
         new InputStreamReader(file.getContents())); // file doesn't exist

Instead of checking for existance, we should catch the core exception and check 
the code for non-existance

Yes, "C:\Documents and Settings\ggregory.PC1073\My 
Documents\eclipse\workspaces\ThirdParty\MicrosoftSecurityClasses\5.00.2922.0
" is one of the deleted folders. I just tried again yesterday and got a dialog 
box about not being able to delete this entry. I did not perform the "moving 
around" myself but I can ask how this was done if it will help but it seems 
that you have pinpointed the problem in the code.
